about.hero_description: Learn about the social objective, technologies used and information about the development of the Faro Guide.
about.objective_p1: The Faro Guide is a public utility project developed with the aim of democratizing access to information about the city of Faro. Created independently and non-profit, this digital guide offers essential information for residents and visitors completely free of charge.
about.objective_p2: The main mission is to facilitate the daily life of those who live or visit Faro, bringing together in one place information about:
about.objective_p3: The project pays special attention to accessibility, including support for assistive technologies, dark mode and content available in Portuguese and English.
about.tech_description: The Faro Guide is developed with modern web technologies, prioritizing performance, accessibility and ease of maintenance:
about.tech_features: The project is 100% frontend, without the need for a backend server, which ensures faster loading and facilitates hosting and maintenance. It includes features such as:
about.tech_features_1: Progressive Web App (PWA) with offline support
about.apis_description: The project integrates data from multiple public and open sources to provide accurate and up-to-date information:
about.api_geo_desc: Portuguese API for geographic and demographic data of Portuguese municipalities.
about.api_cmf_desc: Official information about municipal services, transport and public facilities.
about.api_portal_desc: Data on health services, pharmacies and other public services.
about.api_turismo_desc: Official tourist information, events and points of interest.
about.api_osm_desc: Open collaborative maps used for geographic visualization.
about.api_proximo_desc: Public transport data and real-time schedules.
about.license_description: This project is open source and available under a free license for public use.
about.license_box_p1: ‚úì The content of this site can be freely consulted by anyone
about.license_box_p2: ‚úì The source code is available for consultation and contributions
about.license_box_p3: ‚úì The information is provided for educational and informational purposes
about.license_box_p4: ‚úì All data from external APIs is subject to the licenses of the respective sources
about.author_description: The Faro Guide is developed and maintained independently as a personal public utility project. The development is done voluntarily, non-profit, with the aim of contributing to the local community.
about.author_support: If this project is useful to you, consider supporting it voluntarily through the "Support the Project" button at the bottom of the page. The site will always remain 100% free and without advertising.
about.contact_description: For suggestions, corrections or questions about the project:

privacy.hero_description: How we protect and handle your data at Faro Guide
privacy.intro_p1: Faro Guide respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal data. This privacy policy explains how we handle information when you use our site.
privacy.intro_p2: This site does not collect, store or process identifiable personal data on external servers. All features that require data storage are performed locally on your device.
privacy.local_data_desc: Faro Guide uses browser local storage (LocalStorage) to save preferences and improve your experience. This data is never sent to external servers and includes:
privacy.local_data_item1: Language preferences: To remember if you prefer to see the site in Portuguese or English
privacy.local_data_item2: Theme chosen: To remember if you prefer light or dark mode
privacy.local_data_item3: Favorites: List of pages and places you marked as favorites
privacy.local_data_item4: PWA cache: Pages and resources saved for offline access
privacy.no_personal_desc: Faro Guide does NOT collect or store:
privacy.no_personal_item2: IP address or precise geographic location
privacy.data_usage_desc: Data stored locally on your device is used exclusively to:
privacy.data_usage_item1: Personalize the experience: Show content in preferred language and chosen theme
privacy.data_usage_item2: Offline functionality: Allow access to content without internet connection
privacy.data_usage_item3: Save favorites: Maintain a list of your favorite places and pages
privacy.data_usage_highlight: Important: Since all data is stored locally on your device, you have complete control over it. You can clear this data at any time through your browser settings.
privacy.external_apis_desc: Faro Guide integrates information from external public sources. When accessing this information, you may be subject to the privacy policies of these entities:
privacy.external_apis_item1: GEO API PT: Geographic and demographic data from Portugal
privacy.external_apis_item2: OpenStreetMap: Interactive maps and geographic data
privacy.external_apis_item3: Official sources: Faro City Council, Citizen Portal
privacy.external_apis_note: These integrations do not share your personal data. API queries are made directly from your device.
privacy.cookies_desc: This site does not use tracking cookies, advertising cookies or third-party cookies. We only use browser local storage (LocalStorage and SessionStorage) for essential features described above.
privacy.security_p1: We implement technical security measures to protect the site and its users:
privacy.security_item2: Content Security Policy (CSP): Protection against code injection attacks
privacy.security_item3: No backend: There is no server to store or compromise data
privacy.security_item4: Open source: Code can be publicly audited on GitHub
privacy.rights_desc: Since we do not collect personal data on servers, you have complete control over all locally stored data:
privacy.rights_item1: Access: All data is on your device and can be inspected in browser developer tools
privacy.rights_item2: Deletion: You can clear all data at any time in browser settings (clear browsing data)
privacy.rights_item3: Portability: Favorites can be manually exported if desired
privacy.rights_item4: Objection: You can choose not to use features that store data locally
privacy.external_links_desc: Faro Guide contains links to external sites (city councils, public services, etc.). We are not responsible for the privacy policies of these sites. We recommend reading the privacy policies of any site you visit.
privacy.children_desc: Faro Guide is a public information site suitable for all ages. We do not intentionally collect data from minors under 16 years. Since we do not collect personal data, this site is safe for use by children under parental supervision.
privacy.changes_desc: We may update this privacy policy occasionally. Any changes will be posted on this page with the update date. We recommend reviewing this policy periodically.
privacy.contact_desc: If you have questions about this privacy policy or how we handle data, you can contact us through:

terms.hero_description: Terms of use for Faro Guide
terms.acceptance_p1: By accessing and using the Faro Guide website ("the Site"), you agree to comply with and be bound by the following terms and conditions of use. If you do not agree with any part of these terms, you should not use the Site.
terms.acceptance_p2: These terms apply to all users of the Site, including visitors, Faro residents and tourists accessing the available content.
terms.service_p1: Faro Guide is a free digital guide and public utility that provides information about the city of Faro, Portugal. The Site offers:
terms.service_item1: Information about transport, health, environment and leisure
terms.service_item2: Directories of restaurants, hotels and public services
terms.service_item4: Progressive Web App (PWA) functionality for offline access
terms.service_item5: Bilingual content in Portuguese and English
terms.service_highlight: Note: Faro Guide is an independent and unofficial project. It is not affiliated with Faro City Council or any government entity.
terms.usage_p1: By using Faro Guide, you agree to:
terms.usage_item1: Use the Site only for legal and informational purposes
terms.usage_item2: Not attempt to interfere with Site operation
terms.usage_item3: Not use the Site to transmit malware or malicious content
terms.usage_item4: Not perform scraping or large-scale automated data extraction
terms.usage_item5: Respect the intellectual property rights of the content
terms.intellectual_p1: The original content of Faro Guide, including texts, design, logos and code, is property of the project and is protected by copyright.
terms.intellectual_opensource_desc: The Site's source code is publicly available on GitHub under an open license, allowing other developers to study, modify and contribute to the project.
terms.intellectual_thirdparty_desc: Data and information from external APIs (GEO API PT, OpenStreetMap, etc.) are subject to the licenses and terms of their respective sources.
terms.disclaimer_important: Important: Faro Guide is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind.
terms.disclaimer_accuracy_desc: Although we make reasonable efforts to keep information up to date and accurate:
terms.disclaimer_accuracy_item1: We do not guarantee the accuracy, completeness or timeliness of all information
terms.disclaimer_accuracy_item2: Schedules, contacts and information may change without notice
terms.disclaimer_accuracy_item3: You should always verify critical information (emergencies, schedules, etc.) directly with official sources
terms.disclaimer_accuracy_item4: We are not responsible for errors or omissions in the content
terms.disclaimer_liability_desc: Faro Guide and its creators are not responsible for:
terms.disclaimer_liability_item1: Direct or indirect damages resulting from use of the Site
terms.disclaimer_liability_item5: Decisions made based on the information provided
terms.disclaimer_emergency_desc: In case of medical emergency or urgent situation, always contact official emergency services (112 in Portugal). Do not rely exclusively on information from this Site in critical situations.
terms.external_desc: The Site contains links to third-party websites for your convenience. We do not control nor are we responsible for the content, privacy policies or practices of these external sites. The inclusion of links does not imply endorsement or approval.
terms.modifications_item1: Modify, suspend or discontinue any part of the Site at any time
terms.modifications_item2: Update these terms and conditions periodically
terms.modifications_item3: Change or remove content without notice
terms.modifications_p2: Changes to terms will be posted on this page. Continued use of the Site after modifications constitutes acceptance of the new terms.
terms.availability_desc: Although we strive to keep the Site available 24/7, we do not guarantee uninterrupted access. The Site may be temporarily unavailable due to maintenance, updates or technical problems. We are not responsible for any losses resulting from unavailability.
terms.donations_p1: Faro Guide is completely free. We provide a voluntary donation option for those who wish to financially support the project.
terms.donations_p2: All donations are voluntary and do not confer special rights, privileged access or any type of service contract. Donations are non-refundable and are processed by third-party platforms (such as Buy Me a Coffee), subject to their own terms and conditions.
terms.law_desc: These terms and conditions are governed by Portuguese law. Any dispute related to the use of the Site will be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of Portuguese courts.
terms.contact_desc: If you have questions about these terms and conditions, you can contact us through:
terms.final_acceptance: By using Faro Guide, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to these Terms and Conditions, as well as our Privacy Policy.

health.hero_description: Information about hospitals, health centers, pharmacies and emergency contacts in Faro.
health.pharmacies_info: There are several pharmacies in Faro, with a 24-hour rotation service.
health.pharmacies_on_duty_info: Pharmacies on duty: to check the nearest on-duty pharmacy call Linha Sa√∫de 24: 808 24 24 24 or visit www.portaldasfarmacias.pt
health.note_emergency: Important note: In case of a serious medical emergency, always call 112.

transport.hero_description: Complete guide on night mobility in Faro. Find information about last buses, taxis, TVDE and safe routes to move around the city at night.
transport.important_warning_text: Schedules may vary on weekends and public holidays. Please verify up-to-date schedules on the operator website or mobile app.

environment.hero_description: Information about sustainability, recycling and environmental care in Faro. Together we can make a difference for our city and the planet.
environment.what_to_recycle_intro: Learn about the different types of recycling containers (ecopoints) and what to dispose in each.
environment.ecopoints_description: Main locations of recycling containers (ecopoints) around the city of Faro:
environment.recolha_intro: Free bulky waste collection service (furniture, mattresses, large appliances, etc.)
environment.recolha_details: Bulky waste collection must be scheduled in advance with municipal services. Do not leave bulky items in public spaces without a booking.
environment.attention_text: Hazardous waste, construction debris and tyres should be delivered to the Ecocentre.
environment.ecocentro_intro: Collection centre for waste that cannot be deposited in regular recycling points.
environment.ecocentro_location: Zona Industrial de Faro, S√≠tio das Barradas
environment.ecocentro_accepts_label: ‚ôªÔ∏è What you can deposit at the Ecocentre:
environment.ecocentro_access: Free for residents (must present ID and proof of residence in Faro)
environment.tips_intro: Small actions that make a difference for a more sustainable Faro:
environment.tip_save_water_desc: Turn off the tap while brushing your teeth and prefer quick showers. An open tap wastes about 12 litres of water per minute.
environment.tip_save_energy_desc: Turn off devices on standby and prefer LED bulbs. They can reduce energy consumption by up to 80%.
environment.tip_use_reusable_desc: Always carry a reusable bag when shopping. A plastic bag takes hundreds of years to decompose.
environment.tip_sustainable_mobility_desc: Choose to walk, cycle or use public transport whenever possible. It reduces pollution and is good for health.
environment.tip_avoid_food_waste_desc: Plan meals, use leftovers and compost. In Portugal, about 1 million tonnes of food are wasted each year.
environment.tip_recycle_correctly_desc: Rinse containers before recycling and separate materials correctly. Recycling saves natural resources and energy.
environment.tip_care_greens_desc: Respect parks and gardens, don't litter and help keep Faro clean and green.
environment.tip_protect_ria_desc: The Ria Formosa is a natural treasure. Do not leave rubbish on beaches and respect local fauna and flora.

faq.where_to_process_docs: Where to process official documents and services?

activities.hero_title: What to do today in Faro
activities.simulator_description: Use the simulator below to find activities in Faro that match your interests and schedule.

leisure.hero_description: Discover the best of Faro: beaches, museums, green spaces and cultural events. Explore the city's natural and cultural heritage.
leisure.beaches_intro: Faro is the gateway to some of the Algarve's most beautiful beaches, located in the stunning Ria Formosa, a protected natural park.
leisure.islands_access_desc: Boats depart regularly from the Porta Nova pier (near the historic centre) and Faro Marina to the islands of the Ria Formosa.
leisure.islands_hours: Variable depending on season (more frequent in summer)
leisure.islands_prices: Between ‚Ç¨3 and ‚Ç¨15 (round trip, depending on destination)
leisure.museums_intro: Faro has a rich historical and cultural heritage, with museums that tell the region's story from Roman times to the present day.
leisure.museums_tip: üí° Tip: Many museums offer free entry or discounts on specific days. Check seasonal opening hours, which may vary between summer and winter.
leisure.parks_intro: Faro offers several green spaces perfect for relaxing, exercising or simply enjoying nature.
leisure.parks_birdwatch: üê¶ Birdwatching: The Ria Formosa is one of the best birdwatching spots in Europe, especially during migrations. Over 200 species have been recorded in the area.
leisure.events_intro: Faro has a rich cultural calendar, with traditional events, music festivals, gastronomy and religious celebrations throughout the year.
leisure.events_agenda: üì± Cultural Agenda: Check the full cultural agenda on the Faro City Council website or at the tourist office for exact dates and detailed programming.

restaurants.hero_description: Discover the best cafes, bakeries and restaurants in Faro. Search, filter and find the perfect place to eat or have a coffee in the Algarve capital.

hotels.hero_description: Find the perfect accommodation in Faro. Hotels, hostels, apartments and local stays for all tastes and budgets.

living.description: Essential guide for those who recently moved to Faro. Practical information about documents, transport, health, costs and city areas.
living.documents_intro: When moving to Faro, it's important to update your documents and registrations. Here are the essential steps:
living.financas_desc: You can update it online at www.portaldasfinancas.gov.pt
living.presencial_desc: Faro Tax Office, Rua Dr. Jos√© de Matos, 8000-503 Faro
living.docs_needed_desc: Citizen Card or ID, proof of address (rental contract or utility bill)
living.health_center_intro: To access public health services, you should register at a health center:
living.health_local_desc: Centro de Sa√∫de de Faro, Rua Le√£o Penedo, 8000-355 Faro
living.health_docs_desc: Citizen Card, SNS User Card (if you have one), proof of address
living.health_tip_desc: You can book online via the SNS portal
living.driving_license_intro: If you come from another EU country, you can use your driving license. For non-EU countries:
living.imt_desc: IMT - Instituto da Mobilidade e dos Transportes, EN125, 8000-126 Faro
living.municipal_services_intro: For issues related to the municipality (waste, water, municipal taxes):
living.documents_tip: üí° Important tip: Always bring copies of important documents and an updated proof of address.
living.transport_intro: Faro offers several public transport options and alternatives for travel within and outside the city.
living.transport_tip: üí° Mobility Tip: For more information about transport, check the dedicated Transport page.
living.health_section_intro: Faro has public and private health services to meet residents' needs.
living.health_tip: üí° For more details: Check the full Health page with addresses and a services map.
living.cost_intro: Faro offers a relatively affordable cost of living compared to other district capitals in Portugal, especially Lisbon and Porto.
living.cost_estimate: üí° Total Estimate: A single adult can live comfortably in Faro with ‚Ç¨900-1200/month (including rent). A couple may need ‚Ç¨1500-2000/month.
living.cost_note: Note: These values are estimates based on 2024 data and may vary. Housing prices have increased in recent years due to tourist demand.
living.zones_intro: Faro is divided into several areas, each with its own characteristics. Learn about the main neighborhoods:
living.zones_tip: üí° Choice Tip: Visit different areas before deciding where to live. Consider proximity to work, transport and services that matter to you.

mobility.parking_note: Note: Prices may vary. Always check local signage.

history.hero_description: Discover the rich history of Faro through the centuries, from its foundation to the present day.
history.about_p1: Faro is one of the oldest cities in Portugal, with a history dating back more than two thousand years. Located in the south of the country, in the Algarve region, Faro has been an important commercial and cultural center since Roman times.
history.about_p2: The city was the scene of several significant historical events, from Roman and Moorish occupation to reconstruction after the 1755 earthquake. Today, Faro is the administrative capital of the Algarve and an important tourist destination, preserving its rich historical and cultural heritage.
history.timeline_desc_phoenician: Archaeological evidence indicates that the territory of Faro has been inhabited since the Neolithic period. The Phoenicians established a trading post here, taking advantage of the strategic location next to the Ria Formosa.
history.timeline_desc_roman: During Roman rule, Faro was known as Ossonoba and became an important administrative and commercial center of Lusitania. The city developed significantly with the construction of temples, forums and urban infrastructure.
history.timeline_desc_visigoth: With the fall of the Roman Empire, Ossonoba came under Visigothic rule. The city became an episcopal see, consolidating its religious importance in the region.
history.timeline_desc_moorish: During more than 500 years of Muslim occupation, the city was renamed H√°rune (Santa Maria). This period marked significant development in terms of agriculture, architecture and culture. The walls and urban layout of the historic center date from this time.
history.timeline_desc_reconquest: Faro was the last Algarve city to be reconquered by Christians. King Afonso III took the city, completing the Reconquest of the Algarve. This event marked the end of Muslim rule in the Iberian Peninsula.
history.timeline_desc_discoveries: During the Age of Discoveries, Faro prospered as an important port in maritime trade. The city benefited from the economic and cultural development of this golden period in Portuguese history.
history.timeline_desc_essex: The city was sacked and burned by the Earl of Essex during an English attack. The Bishop of Faro's library was taken to England, where it now forms the founding nucleus of Oxford's Bodleian Library.
history.timeline_desc_earthquake: The great earthquake of 1755 destroyed much of the city. The reconstruction that followed transformed Faro into a Pombaline city, with more rational urban planning and buildings more resistant to earthquakes.
history.timeline_desc_capital: Faro was officially designated capital of the Kingdom of the Algarve, replacing Lagos. This change consolidated the administrative and political importance of the city in the region.
history.timeline_desc_railway: The inauguration of the railway linking Faro to the rest of the country marked the beginning of the city's modernization and facilitated the region's economic and tourist development.
history.timeline_desc_airport: The inauguration of Faro Airport significantly boosted tourism in the Algarve, making the region more accessible to international visitors and contributing to local economic development.
history.timeline_desc_university: The creation of the University of the Algarve in Faro transformed the city into an important center of teaching and research, attracting students and academics from all over the country and abroad.
history.timeline_desc_modern: Today, Faro is a modern city that combines its rich historical heritage with contemporary infrastructure. It is the administrative capital of the Algarve, an important tourist destination and a vibrant cultural center.
history.evolution_description: The urban evolution of Faro reflects the different eras and cultural influences that have marked the city over the centuries.
history.evolution_historic_desc: The medieval core, surrounded by walls from the Islamic period, preserves the ancient urban layout. Notable features include the Cathedral, the Arco da Vila and the episcopal palaces, all rebuilt after 1755.
history.evolution_pombaline_desc: After the 1755 earthquake, the city expanded following Pombaline urban planning principles, with wide streets and an orthogonal layout. This area is characterized by neoclassical buildings and greater urban regularity.
history.evolution_waterfront_desc: The development of the Riverside Park and marina transformed the waterfront into a leisure and tourism space. The redevelopment of this area enhanced the city's relationship with the Ria Formosa.
history.evolution_modern_desc: In the 20th century, Faro expanded significantly to the north and west, with new residential neighborhoods, commercial areas and the university campus. The airport and highways improved accessibility.
history.evolution_natural_desc: The Ria Formosa, classified as a Natural Park in 1987, is a fundamental element of Faro's identity. The preservation of this unique ecosystem conditions and enriches urban development.
history.evolution_future_desc: Current development plans focus on sustainability, urban mobility, redevelopment of public spaces and promotion of Faro's cultural and historical identity.
history.footer_data_sources: Data sources: Faro City Council, Faro Municipal Museum, University of the Algarve

guia_premium.linhas_de_autocarros_completas_horrios_t: Full bus lines, schedules, updated fares, and tips for trains and taxis
guia_premium.calendrio_completo_de_eventos_anuais_fes: Complete calendar of annual events, local festivities, cultural life and entertainment
guia_premium.pratos_tpicos_detalhados_restaurantes_re: Typical dishes, recommended restaurants, local markets and useful Portuguese phrases
guia_premium.comparao_de_opes_por_categoria_preos_mdi: Comparison of options by category, average prices and practical booking tips
guia_premium.lista_completa_de_emergncias_servios_pbl: Complete list of emergencies, public services, embassies and useful contacts
guia_premium.este_guia_premium_foi_criado_como_forma: This premium guide was created to offer additional content for those who wish to support the Faro Guide project.
guia_premium.se_preferir_pode_apoiar_o_projeto_atravs: If you prefer, you can support the project via the 'Support the Project' donation link in the footer.
guia_premium.pdf_de_20kb_com_11_seces_detalhadas_sobr: 20KB PDF with 11 detailed sections about Faro. Voluntary support helps maintain the project.

guia_premium.sim_o_guia_atualizado_regularmente_com: Yes, the guide is updated regularly with accurate information about Faro. This edition is from 2024.

lazer.instalado_no_antigo_convento_de_nossa_se: Housed in the former Convent of Our Lady of the Assumption (16th century). Exhibitions of archaeology, sacred art and Algarve ethnography.
lazer.largo_dom_afonso_iii_centro_histrico: üìç Largo Dom Afonso III, Historic Centre
lazer.coleo_etnogrfica_que_mostra_o_modo_de_vi: Ethnographic collection showing traditional Algarve life: crafts, agricultural tools, typical costumes and recreated settings.
lazer.espao_interativo_dedicado_divulgao_da_c: Interactive space dedicated to science outreach, with exhibitions about the sea, astronomy and the biodiversity of the Ria Formosa.
lazer.rua_comandante_francisco_manuel_junto: üìç Rua Comandante Francisco Manuel, near Doca de Faro
lazer.porta_monumental_de_entrada_ao_centro_hi: Monumental gate to the historic centre, built in the 19th century over Roman and Arab remains. From the top, panoramic views of the city.
lazer.capela_nica_decorada_com_ossos_e_caveira: Unique chapel decorated with bones and skulls of over 1000 monks. A 19th-century religious and artistic monument.
lazer.igreja_do_carmo_largo_do_carmo: üìç Igreja do Carmo, Largo do Carmo
lazer.catedral_gticarenascentista_do_sculo_xii: Gothic-Renaissance cathedral from the 13th century, built over a former mosque. Tower with panoramic views over Faro and the Ria Formosa.
lazer.jardim_histrico_junto_ao_porto_com_rvore: Historic garden next to the harbour with century-old trees and views over the Ria Formosa. A traditional meeting point for locals.
lazer.parque_moderno_junto_doca_ideal_para_ca: Modern park by the dock, ideal for walking, running and cycling. Wide green space with views of the marina and Ria Formosa.

oque_fazer_hoje.escolha_o_dia_da_semana: üìÖ Choose the day of the week
oque_fazer_hoje.apanhe_o_barco_no_cais_e_descubra_as_ilh: Catch a boat at the pier and discover Faro's islands. Praia de Faro, Ilha Deserta and Culatra are perfect for a sunny day.
oque_fazer_hoje.explore_o_parque_ribeirinho_de_faro_de_b: Explore the Parque Ribeirinho by bike or on foot. Stunning views over the Ria Formosa and the marina.
oque_fazer_hoje.visite_a_quinta_de_marim_no_parque_natur: Visit Quinta de Marim in the Ria Formosa Natural Park. Hiking trails and birdwatching in a unique natural environment.
oque_fazer_hoje.tours_pela_ria_formosa_com_observao_da_f: Ria Formosa tours with wildlife observation. Sunset trips are especially beautiful.
oque_fazer_hoje.passeie_pelas_ruas_calcetadas_do_centro: Stroll the cobbled streets of the historic centre, visit the Cathedral and climb Arco da Vila for panoramic views.
oque_fazer_hoje.aproveite_os_campos_de_golfe_de_classe_m: Enjoy world-class golf courses at Quinta do Lago and Vale do Lobo, near Faro.
oque_fazer_hoje.descubra_a_histria_de_faro_no_antigo_con: Discover Faro's history in the former Convent of Our Lady of the Assumption. Archaeology and sacred art collections.
oque_fazer_hoje.espao_interativo_dedicado_cincia_perfei: Interactive science space‚Äîperfect for curious children and adults exploring exhibits about the sea and astronomy.
oque_fazer_hoje.veja_as_ltimas_estreias_no_cinema_do_fru: See the latest releases at the F√≥rum Algarve cinema. Multiple screens with 3D and IMAX.
oque_fazer_hoje.assista_a_peas_de_teatro_concertos_ou_ex: Attend plays, concerts or exhibitions at Faro's main cultural venue.
oque_fazer_hoje.espao_moderno_para_ler_estudar_ou_usar_a: Modern space to read, study or use the internet. Large book collection and study rooms.
oque_fazer_hoje.centro_comercial_com_lojas_restaurantes: Shopping centre with shops, restaurants, cinema and entertainment‚Äîgreat for family days.
oque_fazer_hoje.visite_esta_capela_nica_decorada_com_oss: Visit this unique chapel decorated with bones and skulls. A singular cultural and historical experience.
oque_fazer_hoje.jardim_histrico_junto_ao_porto_perfeito: Historic garden by the harbour, perfect for a picnic or relaxing with the family.
oque_fazer_hoje.parques_infantis_bem_equipados_no_parque: Well-equipped playgrounds at the Riverside Park and several city gardens.
oque_fazer_hoje.caminhe_pela_zona_ribeirinha_aprecie_a_v: Walk along the riverside, enjoy views of the Ria Formosa and stop for an ice cream on a terrace.
oque_fazer_hoje.cafs_com_wifi_e_ambiente_tranquilo_para: Caf√©s with Wi‚ÄëFi and a quiet atmosphere for studying. Areas in Baixa and near the University.
oque_fazer_hoje.bares_e_discotecas_na_zona_da_marina_e_c: Bars and clubs around the Marina and Historic Centre. Lively atmosphere, especially on weekends.
oque_fazer_hoje.campos_de_futebol_basquetebol_e_instalae: Football and basketball fields and public sports facilities. Montenegro sports area and other complexes.
oque_fazer_hoje.restaurantes_com_menus_econmicos_para_es: Restaurants with student-friendly menus. Several options near the University and the city centre.
oque_fazer_hoje.cafs_e_espaos_com_consolas_e_jogos_de_ta: Caf√©s and venues with consoles and board games. Relaxed spots to hang out with friends.

problemas_frequentes.problemas_relacionados_com_estacionament: Problems related to irregular parking, abandoned vehicles, improper occupation of reserved spaces or broken parking meters are common issues that can be reported.

transportes.os_autocarros_em_faro_tm_um_servio_limit: Buses in Faro have limited service at night. Plan ahead and check last-bus schedules to ensure you can get home.
transportes.descarregue_a_aplicao_da_proximo_para_co: Download the Proximo app to check real-time schedules
transportes.chegue_paragem_com_510_minutos_de_antec: Arrive at the stop 5-10 minutes early

transportes.guarde_o_nmero_de_um_txi_no_telemvel: Save a taxi number on your phone
transportes.os_txis_esto_disponveis_24_horas_por_dia: Taxis are available 24 hours a day in Faro. They are a safe and reliable option for night travel, especially when buses no longer run.
transportes.confirme_que_o_taxmetro_est_ligado_no_in: Confirm the taximeter is on at the start of the trip
transportes.pea_sempre_recibo_ao_motorista: Always ask the driver for a receipt

transportes.se_possvel_reserve_com_antecedncia_para: If possible, reserve in advance for specific times
transportes.as_plataformas_tvde_so_alternativas_mode: TVDE platforms are modern alternatives to traditional taxis. They operate via mobile apps, allowing you to track the trip, see the price in advance and rate the driver.
transportes.partilha_de_viagem_com_amigosfamlia_para: Share trip with friends/family for safety

transportes.partilhe_os_detalhes_da_viagem_com_algum: Share trip details with someone you trust
transportes.avalie_o_motorista_aps_a_viagem_para_aju: Rate the driver after the trip to help other users
transportes.em_horrios_de_pico_considere_pedir_a_via: In peak hours, consider requesting the ride a few minutes in advance
transportes.faro_considerada_uma_cidade_segura_mas: Faro is considered a safe city, but it is always important to take precautions when walking at night. Know the safest and best-lit routes.
transportes.evite_atalhos_por_zonas_desertas_ou_mal: Avoid shortcuts through deserted or poorly lit areas
transportes.tenha_sempre_dinheiro_para_um_txi_ou_tvd: Always have cash for a taxi or balance for TVDE
transportes.informe_algum_sobre_o_seu_trajeto_e_hora: Tell someone about your route and arrival time
transportes.use_aplicaes_de_partilha_de_localizao_co: Use location-sharing apps with trusted people
transportes.embora_faro_seja_segura_algumas_zonas_po: Although Faro is safe, some areas can be more deserted at night. Avoid:
transportes.ruas_muito_desertas_sem_iluminao_adequad: Very deserted streets without adequate lighting
transportes.consulte_sempre_os_horrios_dos_autocarro: Always check bus schedules before leaving
transportes.tenha_dinheiro_extra_para_um_txi_ou_sald: Have extra cash for a taxi or balance for TVDE
transportes.em_caso_de_emergncia_ligue_sempre_para_o: In case of emergency, always call 112
transportes.portal_da_cmara_municipal_para_informaes: City council portal for public lighting information
transportes.considere_partilhar_viagens_de_tvde_com: Consider sharing TVDE trips with friends to reduce costs
transportes.se_sair_regularmente_noite_crie_uma_rot: If you go out regularly at night, create a transport routine
transportes.conhea_bem_os_horrios_dos_ltimos_autocar: Know the schedules of the last buses on your usual routes
transportes.mantenha_sempre_um_contacto_de_emergncia: Always keep an emergency contact accessible
transportes.respeite_as_regras_de_segurana_rodoviria: Follow road safety rules, even as a passenger

health_now.hero_description: Quick access to essential health services in Faro
health_now.sns24_description: Call to get free 24-hour health advice, guidance on symptoms and information about on-duty pharmacies.
health_now.sns24_services: Medical advice, symptom triage, on-duty pharmacies
health_now.emergency_description: In case of serious medical emergency (life-threatening, serious accident, loss of consciousness), call immediately.
health_now.health_centers_description: For non-urgent health problems, consult your health center.
health_now.pharmacies_description: Pharmacies have a rotating 24-hour service system. To find out which is on duty today:
health_now.poison_description: In case of intoxication or poisoning, contact the Poison Information Center.
health_now.disclaimer_text: This page provides general information and does not replace professional medical advice, diagnosis or treatment. In case of doubt or medical emergency, always contact a qualified healthcare professional or call 112. The information presented here is in the public domain and is subject to change without notice.

seniors.hero_description: Useful and accessible information for Faro's senior population. Find social support, services, transport and activities designed for you.
seniors.emergency_intro: Important numbers you should always have at hand:
seniors.social_support_intro: Social support services available in Faro for the senior population:
seniors.seg_social_desc: Support for pensions, supplements, social benefits and other support.
seniors.santa_casa_label: Santa Casa da Miseric√≥rdia de Faro
seniors.santa_casa_desc: Home care, nursing home, day center and other social services.
seniors.camara_desc: Municipal programs and initiatives to support seniors.
seniors.day_centers_intro: Day centers offer activities, meals and socializing during the day:
seniors.centro_dia_1_name: Santa Casa da Miseric√≥rdia Day Center
seniors.centro_dia_1_services: Occupational activities, food, hygiene care and socializing
seniors.centro_dia_2_services: Day center, home care and recreational activities
seniors.centro_dia_3_services: Senior community center with daily activities
seniors.transport_intro: Adapted transport options and special fares for seniors:
seniors.transport_pass_desc: People over 65 are entitled to reduced fares on public transport. The Social+ Pass allows unlimited travel on Proximo transport for a reduced price.
seniors.transport_taxi_desc: Taxi service with vehicles adapted for people with reduced mobility.
seniors.transport_social_desc: The City Council and some institutions offer free or reduced-price transport for medical appointments and activities. Contact the Council's Social Action for more information.
seniors.activities_intro: Participate in activities designed for seniors in Faro:
seniors.activity_1_desc: Adapted gym classes at municipal sports halls and day centers. Contact the City Council for schedules.
seniors.activity_2_desc: Courses, workshops and cultural activities for over 50s.
seniors.activity_3_desc: Faro Municipal Theater and Municipal Library offer regular programming with reduced rates for seniors.
seniors.activity_4_desc: Walking groups and excursions organized by the City Council and local associations.
seniors.activity_5_desc: Free basic computing and internet courses at the Municipal Library and community centers.
seniors.health_center_desc: General and family medicine consultations, nursing and specialties.
seniors.health_home_desc: Several institutions offer nursing and home support services. Contact your health center or Santa Casa da Miseric√≥rdia for more information.
seniors.tip_1_desc: In case of loneliness or need to talk: 800 207 256 (free line)
seniors.tip_2_desc: Pensioners with low income may be entitled to 100% reimbursement for medicines. Check with your health center.
seniors.tip_3_desc: The City Council has support programs for adapting homes (grab bars, ramps, etc.). Contact Social Services.
seniors.tip_4_desc: Always carry: Citizen Card, SNS User Card and family contacts for emergencies.
